main event: A witness observed two lights that appeared to move in a periodic, coordinated manner in the Richmond, Maine area on March 22, 1966.
interesting points: One light was stationary while the other light moved relative to it.
The witness initially thought the lights were ships rather than aircraft.
The witness believed the lights were being observed as a joke on other people who had reported seeing similar lights in the area.
Another witness in the area observed a disc-shaped object with lights around the circumference and a central brilliant light on March 23, 1966.
The disc-shaped object crossed the witness's line of vision at a rapid pace, without any sound, and disappeared from sight.
sighted object: two lights that appeared to move in a coordinated manner, and a disc-shaped object with lights
witnesses: civilian, including a witness and their daughter
